articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will convene his security cabinet on Thursday evening to discuss new Hamas positions on a ceasefire deal in Gaza, a source in Netanyahu's office said, as fighting in the enclave raged.
articles.title: Israel weighs Hamas response to Gaza ceasefire proposal

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill, Elizabeth Piper, Alistair Smout
articles.description: Keir Starmer will be Britain's next prime minister with his Labour Party set to win a massive majority in a parliamentary election, an exit poll on Thursday indicated, while Rishi Sunak's Conservatives are forecast to suffer historic losses.
articles.title: UK's Labour on course for massive election majority, exit poll shows

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: China on Thursday rejected Western-led recommendations for human-rights reforms including calls for greater freedoms in Hong Kong and for Uyghurs in Xinjiang, but accepted others from allies, as it sought to defend its record at a U.N. meeting.
articles.title: China rejects key Western calls for human-rights reforms at U.N. meeting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping urged members of a regional security club on Thursday to resist external meddling, while President Vladimir Putin was due to speak about creating a new Eurasian security system at the group's annual meeting.
articles.title: Xi and Putin set out ambitions for Eurasian security club

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: Saudi Arabia's main humanitarian agency said on Thursday the Israeli closure of Rafah and other crossings into Gaza was hampering its aid efforts to send lifesaving food, some of which was in danger of spoiling.
articles.title: Saudi Arabia's Gaza aid threatened by Rafah closure, aid official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas made a pretty significant adjustment in its position over a potential hostage release deal with Israel, a senior U.S. administration official said on Thursday, expressing hope that it would lead to a pact that would be a step to a permanent ceasefire.
articles.title: US sees 'breakthrough' in Israel-Hamas talks, senior official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States welcomed a two-week humanitarian truce in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), the White House said on Thursday, amid fierce fighting between government troops and Rwanda-backed M23 rebels.
articles.title: US welcomes humanitarian truce in Congo, White House says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Peru's Congress passed a law on Thursday introducing a statute of limitations for crimes against humanity, despite opposition from human rights organizations who argue the measure will hamper ongoing investigations into serious abuses.
articles.title: Peru Congress approves statute of limitations for crimes against humanity

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazilian federal police on Thursday formally accused former President Jair Bolsonaro of embezzlement for misappropriating jewelry he received while head of state, including luxury items given by the Saudi Arabian government, two police sources said.
articles.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro formally accused over Saudi gifts, sources say

articles.author: Dawoud Abu Alkas
articles.description: St. Philip's church once offered a haven of devotion to Gaza's small Christian community. After nine months of Israeli military action that has devastated the Palestinian enclave's health system, priests have turned it into a hospital.
articles.title: Gaza church opens doors to injured and sick as hospitals fill
